terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - documented step-by-step instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, providing easy access and organization
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers
The ability for multiple users to work on and edit the same document simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants
A software platform that helps organizations create, store, organize, and maintain their documents and knowledge resources efficiently
Documents that are properly organized, up-to-date, and formatted to meet regulatory requirements for easy review during compliance audits
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems, helping organizations ensure consistent quality in their products and services
An aerospace industry quality management standard that extends ISO 9001 requirements specifically for aviation, space, and defense organizations
Records that communicate important information between different work shifts, including ongoing tasks, issues, and status updates
A structured process for reviewing, approving, and implementing changes to documents or systems while maintaining proper documentation and communication
A systematic method of identifying the underlying reasons for problems or failures to prevent them from recurring
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies through proper documentation and procedures
System-generated alerts that inform users about document updates, changes, or required actions without manual intervention
